qas.question: What percentage of Dell support calls were transferred?

What percentage of Dell support calls weren't transferred?
What percentage of IBM support calls were transferred?
How much did Dell originally spend to end their customer service?

context: In 2006, Dell acknowledged that it had problems with customer service. Issues included call transfers of more than <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>45%<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> of calls and long wait times. Dell's blog detailed the response: "We're spending more than a <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>$100 million<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> — and a lot of blood, sweat and tears of talented people — to fix this." Later in the year, the company increased its spending on customer service to <a2_0><b7_0>$150 million<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Despite significant investment in this space, Dell continues to face public scrutiny with even the company's own website littered with complaints regarding the issue escalation process.[original research?]
